source.dc2ec788:
# pie chart 
pie = ctc.Pie('Content type on Netflix', # title
              width='720px',height='720px')

# set the chart options
pie.set_options(labels=list(content_type.index), # country names as labels
                inner_radius=0,                  # inner radius set to 0
                colors=['#ee333c','#168ab5'])

# label to be shown on graph
pie.add_series(list(content_type['count'])) 

# display the charts
pie.render_notebook()

source.66b3f2f2: This notebook is a simple introduction to cutecharts library. It is a cool python hand-painted styles visualization package, which is totally different from the regular Matplotlib and Seaborn library. Hovering effect is an advantage of cutecharts library. For now, this python library support five different charts - Bar, Pie, Line Radar & Scatter, Here, I will be plotting pie, donut, line and bar chart with Netflix data.
